mittelbayerische.de.307290.1: Ingenious guitarist, drug junkie, cult pendant: The co-founder of the band Fleetwood Mac, Peter Green, is dead.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.2: He died peacefully in his sleep at the age of 73, family members announced on Saturday in an official statement that a further statement would be announced for the next few days.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.3: Top musicians like Peter Frampton honored Green as one of the best blues and rock guitarists.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.4: Mick Fleetwood spoke in an emotional reaction of a "monumental loss" for all former and present members of the band Fleetwood Mac.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.5: The other 15 clubs have an average budget of 130 million, "said the 58-year-old.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.6: The drummer Fleetwood and the guitarist Green had founded the now legendary band in London in 1967, until today his dreamy instrumental hit "Albatross" is unforgettable.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.7: The life of the musician ("The End Of The Game", "In The Skies") resembled a roller coaster ride.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.8: With Fleetwood Mac Green experienced a rapid rise - the band celebrated their greatest successes but then without him.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.9: There was controversy, among other things, because Green wanted to donate all the profits of the group for charitable purposes.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.10: He began to appear in wide robes and with large crucifix.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.11: Mental problems are also said to have played a role.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.12: Three years after its founding, Green left the band in 1970.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.14: The blues rock guitarist suffered from drug abuse and schizophrenia, as biographers reported.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.15: For a long time, Green was treated in psychiatry.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.16: Looking at the past, Grindel feels betrayed.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.17: During a large part of the 1970s, the musician disappeared from the picture area.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.18: He is said to have lived on the streets for a time, worked as a cemetery gardener and spent some time in an Israeli kibbutz.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.19: Green was born in 1946 to a Jewish working-class family in Bethnal Green, London.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.20: At a young age, he became enthusiastic about American blues musicians such as B.B. King and Muddy Waters.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.21: At the age of eleven, he learned the first guitar grips.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.22: At the age of 15, the teenager began playing guitar professionally and got the chance five years later to stand as lead guitarist for the instrumental band Peter B's Looners on stage.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.23: Later, he was hired to replace his Idol Eric Clapton with the Bluesbreakers.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.24: In the middle of the blues boom, Green founded Fleetwood Mac in the summer of 1967 together with his bluesbreakers Mick Fleetwood and John McVie.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.25: The song "Albatross" composed by Green gave the group the first number-one hit in the winter of 1968 / 69 and catapulted it to the top of the British music scene.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.26: But the rapid rise soon showed his shadow sides: Green did not cope with the media rumble, his experiments with the drug LSD became ever more extreme.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.27: He later commented on the life between music and addiction in an interview: "The worst thing that happened to me in life is the drugs - the best thing was to land a number-one hit".
mittelbayerische.de.307290.28: "Unfortunately, there have been people who have noticed this mistake and pierced the press instead of addressing it," said Grindel about the adoption of an expensive watch that had led to his resignation in April 2019.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.29: Towards the end of the decade, Green surprisingly achieved an eighth success with an album inspired by religious themes.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.30: Fleetwood Mac swam without him in a new formation on a wave of success.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.31: Their 1977 album "Rumours" sold more than 40 million copies worldwide.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.32: Despite several minor solo successes, Green did not make a major comeback until he started again in 1996 with a group of friends musicians.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.33: The British "Daily Telegraph" then spoke of a rock star returning to Earth.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.34: Green released several albums with Peter Green Splinter Group until the band disbanded in 2004.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.35: For music experts, he was already a blues legend during his lifetime - and with his gentle sound he was one of the most influential guitarists of the past decades.
